page.title: 19Memories-A Thorpe Resident
page.content: Sheet 2 the same time, when sets were all black and white. As a child she lived at{Spinkhill,}near{Killamarsh,}where she attended{school}and learned reading, writing, arithmetic, sewing and knitting. In the playground the favourite games were skipping, whips and tops, badminton, battle board, which was a type of wooden racquet, and hoops. After{school}she would help her mother with the housework and with preparing the{meals,}which were often porridge or soup. After leaving school she was employed in service as a maid, having a holiday once a year at{Cleethorpes.}She finds much of todays fashions "silly", especially the young people who have coloured hair or wear it in a spiky, Mohican style. Changes in services are now worse, with no shops or Post Office.
